Pros: excellent camera for the $$$ ,when i purchased this camera i didnt expect much for the $$,but i was happily wrong with this that assumption,it has  easy to understand optoins, takes great indoor and out door pics., eaven takes short vidio,w/27MB of built in memory, you just cant beat the price !!!

Title: Read the Reviews (all of em)
Cons:
After taking literally hundreds of shots (many of the same thing multitudes of times) this camera just isn't consistant. Indoor shots are grainy, grainy, grainy. The camera struggles to focus indoors and compensates by using a higher ISO. Anything over ISO 200 is pretty much useless but that's not uncommon in a point and shoot.

Outdoors this camers fares infinitely better. 

The bundled Fuji software is useless, I like the MS wizard much better, it's faster and doesn't automatically move the photo's into the Fuji folder (without asking) where it's much more complicated to do any adjustments or cropping.

The USB door and the battery door both seem somewhat flimsy. Time will tell.
Pros:
There really are a myriad of things to like about this camera. Everything is well thought out, buttons are placed logically, numerous shooting modes, EVF, pop up flash, menu relatively easy to navigate through. When you get a great shot the detail is unparalled. 

Takes SD/SDHC or xD memory. I'm using an 4G SDHC card. I like being able to use AA and rechargeable NiMH batteries. Ability to shoot in color, chrome or B&W. Plenty of manual modes.

Mostly I like the size. It's not like trying to take a picture with a credit card which I find awkward. The grip is rubberized which makes it firm and easy to hold. Boots up and is ready to go in about 1 second. Memory card slot is separate from the battery compartment. 

Definately a bang for the buck.
Comments:
The macro mode is incredible, detail is better than my Lumix DMC-LZ7or Canon S5 IS. The strap design is awful, once it's on it's on, it's very diffucult to remove or adjust. Lens cap snaps on and off easily but must be attached to the strap. Where I naturally want to grip the camera with my left hand is right over the pop-up flash, guess I'll try and get used to it. 

I am going to keep playing with this but I'm betting I'll return it. I want to love it, so far I just can't.

Title: Great buy!!
Cons: Indoor pictures come out a bit grainy and yellowed in natural light.  The flash is almost too bright for indoor pictures.  I had the camera glitch saying "Memory Full" once an SD card had filled.  It would no longer take a photo.  After formatting the card, buying a new card, trying everything - I almost gave up.  I stumbled onto a fix - I removed the card, turned on the camera and took a picture into its internal memory.  This cleared the Memory Full lockout, and I could use SD cards again.
Pros: Price is right.  Outdoor pictures come out great.  The battery life is around 500 pictures or more depending on use.  Movies come out in great detail.  TONS of shooting modes including night, fireworks, super macro closeup, etc...  Overall I am very happy with the purchase.
Comments: (Optimize battery life by using an xD card, using the viewfinder, keeping camera on-time to a , avoiding the flash when possible, and don't review photos using the LCD.)  This would likely double the battery life which is already good IMO.

Cons: No problems with my computer finding it, but didn't come with an install disk so some computers might have trouble finding it.
Pros: Great Camera for a terrific price!!! The macro setting is what I bought the camera for since I like to take a lot of pictures of the flowers and fish that I catch.
Comments: My mom has been so thrilled with the quality of my pictures that she is ordering one now!!!

Title: Professional features, entry price!
Cons: No option for additional lenses
Pros: 10x Optical Zoom, 7.1MP, wide array of shooting options (including manual shutter speed controls), ergonomic design fits comfortably in your hands and feels "sturdy and balanced", SLR-like design, entry-level price
Comments: This is a remarkable camera for the price...don't question getting it...just buy the thing!

Title: Awesome camera for the cost
Cons: Slight lag in button push and picture take on some manual settings NO other cons found yet
Pros: Look, if you want a great little digital camera for a great price, buy it.  Easy to use. Excellent pictures on almost all settings, Video is good, 46mm threads on lens for accessories, Too many goodies to discover in a month, anti-shake works well, I LOVE IT.
Comments: Just get one, you'll be happy. Don't buy from those other DISCOUNT places.... you'll wind up with NEWEGG on your face.

Title: Great "Prosumer" Camera
Cons:
Any negatives I have are more: "I wish it had" than real cons. 

I wish it had a "bulb" setting to give a little more creativity to the user. (it has a 4 sec. to 1/1000 shutter range)
If you don't want to use the large (2.5") rear LCD, for framing your shots, it uses an eye level electronic view finder (EVF). Either of which are always on and can be a power usage concern - although, battery life was still pretty good. I used the camera on and off for a day and captured about 170 pix using 2400mAh batteries. 
I wish it had and optical eye level view finder, but then there would be parallax problems with the 10X zoom and the cost of linking the optics to the view finder would surely add a lot more to the price (keep saving for a DSLR if you want features like that).
Image color is very good, but... areas of high contrast - say where the sky meets the trees - has some bluish purple fringing. Still, the images I took that were under even contrast or those at sunset were awesome!
Pros:
Great  "Prosumer" dig. camera for the price (and it's now about a hundred $ less than last year's average price). 

7-megapixels, 10x optical zoom lens (38-380mm in 35mm equivalence), a lot of exposure modes, takes SD and xD cards, takes very good movies with sound (and you can even zoom while shooting movies).
Uses 4 AA batteries, so you're never far from spares (but get a set of 2400 NiMH rechargeable batteries for better use).
It can capture 3 frames in under 2 seconds in "Top 3"mode and continuously at about 2 second intervals in "Long Period" mode. 
A ISO range of 64 to 1600 (but shadows start to get a little noisey at 400 and highlights at 800).
Comments:
One more (con?); the LCD or EyeVF blacks out in between shots (not in the burst mode, though). A little like closing your eyes when you press the shutter relese.
But again, it's providing a nearly SLR-like view finder for a lower price, I you want an SLR you'll have to pay about 4 times (starting price) than what you'll pay for this camera.

This would be great camera even if it cost a hundred $ more.

The bundled Fuji software is useless, I like the MS wizard much better, it's faster and doesn't automatically move the photo's into the Fuji folder (without asking) where it's much more complicated to do any adjustments or cropping.

The USB door and the battery door both seem somewhat flimsy. Time will tell.
Pros:
There really are a myriad of things to like about this camera. Everything is well thought out, buttons are placed logically, numerous shooting modes, EVF, pop up flash, menu relatively easy to navigate through. When you get a great shot the detail is unparalled. 

Takes SD/SDHC or xD memory. I'm using an 4G SDHC card. I like being able to use AA and rechargeable NiMH batteries. Ability to shoot in color, chrome or B&W. Plenty of manual modes.

Mostly I like the size. It's not like trying to take a picture with a credit card which I find awkward. The grip is rubberized which makes it firm and easy to hold. Boots up and is ready to go in about 1 second. Memory card slot is separate from the battery compartment. 

Definately a bang for the buck.
Comments:
The macro mode is incredible, detail is better than my Lumix DMC-LZ7or Canon S5 IS. The strap design is awful, once it's on it's on, it's very diffucult to remove or adjust. Lens cap snaps on and off easily but must be attached to the strap. Where I naturally want to grip the camera with my left hand is right over the pop-up flash, guess I'll try and get used to it. 

I am going to keep playing with this but I'm betting I'll return it. I want to love it, so far I just can't.

Title: Great buy!!
Cons: Indoor pictures come out a bit grainy and yellowed in natural light.  The flash is almost too bright for indoor pictures.  I had the camera glitch saying "Memory Full" once an SD card had filled.  It would no longer take a photo.  After formatting the card, buying a new card, trying everything - I almost gave up.  I stumbled onto a fix - I removed the card, turned on the camera and took a picture into its internal memory.  This cleared the Memory Full lockout, and I could use SD cards again.
Pros: Price is right.  Outdoor pictures come out great.  The battery life is around 500 pictures or more depending on use.  Movies come out in great detail.  TONS of shooting modes including night, fireworks, super macro closeup, etc...  Overall I am very happy with the purchase.
Comments: (Optimize battery life by using an xD card, using the viewfinder, keeping camera on-time to a , avoiding the flash when possible, and don't review photos using the LCD.)  This would likely double the battery life which is already good IMO.

Cons: No problems with my computer finding it, but didn't come with an install disk so some computers might have trouble finding it.
Pros: Great Camera for a terrific price!!! The macro setting is what I bought the camera for since I like to take a lot of pictures of the flowers and fish that I catch.
Comments: My mom has been so thrilled with the quality of my pictures that she is ordering one now!!!

Comments: This is a remarkable camera for the price...don't question getting it...just buy the thing!

Title: Awesome camera for the cost
Cons: Slight lag in button push and picture take on some manual settings NO other cons found yet

Comments: Just get one, you'll be happy. Don't buy from those other DISCOUNT places.... you'll wind up with NEWEGG on your face.

Title: Great "Prosumer" Camera
Cons:
Any negatives I have are more: "I wish it had" than real cons. 

I wish it had a "bulb" setting to give a little more creativity to the user. (it has a 4 sec. to 1/1000 shutter range)
If you don't want to use the large (2.5") rear LCD, for framing your shots, it uses an eye level electronic view finder (EVF). Either of which are always on and can be a power usage concern - although, battery life was still pretty good. I used the camera on and off for a day and captured about 170 pix using 2400mAh batteries. 
I wish it had and optical eye level view finder, but then there would be parallax problems with the 10X zoom and the cost of linking the optics to the view finder would surely add a lot more to the price (keep saving for a DSLR if you want features like that).
Image color is very good, but... areas of high contrast - say where the sky meets the trees - has some bluish purple fringing. Still, the images I took that were under even contrast or those at sunset were awesome!
Pros:
Great  "Prosumer" dig. camera for the price (and it's now about a hundred $ less than last year's average price). 

7-megapixels, 10x optical zoom lens (38-380mm in 35mm equivalence), a lot of exposure modes, takes SD and xD cards, takes very good movies with sound (and you can even zoom while shooting movies).
Uses 4 AA batteries, so you're never far from spares (but get a set of 2400 NiMH rechargeable batteries for better use).
It can capture 3 frames in under 2 seconds in "Top 3"mode and continuously at about 2 second intervals in "Long Period" mode. 
A ISO range of 64 to 1600 (but shadows start to get a little noisey at 400 and highlights at 800).
Comments:
One more (con?); the LCD or EyeVF blacks out in between shots (not in the burst mode, though). A little like closing your eyes when you press the shutter relese.
But again, it's providing a nearly SLR-like view finder for a lower price, I you want an SLR you'll have to pay about 4 times (starting price) than what you'll pay for this camera.

This would be great camera even if it cost a hundred $ more.

The macro mode is incredible, detail is better than my Lumix DMC-LZ7or Canon S5 IS. The strap design is awful, once it's on it's on, it's very diffucult to remove or adjust. I am going to keep playing with this but I'm betting I'll return it. I want to love it, so far I just can't.

Title: Great buy!!
Cons: Indoor pictures come out a bit grainy and yellowed in natural light.  The flash is almost too bright for indoor pictures.  I had the camera glitch saying "Memory Full" once an SD card had filled.  It would no longer take a photo.  After formatting the card, buying a new card, trying everything - I almost gave up.  I stumbled onto a fix - I removed the card, turned on the camera and took a picture into its internal memory.  This cleared the Memory Full lockout, and I could use SD cards again.
Pros: Price is right.  Outdoor pictures come out great.  The battery life is around 500 pictures or more depending on use.  Movies come out in great detail.  TONS of shooting modes including night, fireworks, super macro closeup, etc...  Overall I am very happy with the purchase.
Comments: (Optimize battery life by using an xD card, using the viewfinder, keeping camera on-time to a , avoiding the flash when possible, and don't review photos using the LCD.)  This would likely double the battery life which is already good IMO.

Cons: No problems with my computer finding it, but didn't come with an install disk so some computers might have trouble finding it.
Pros: Great Camera for a terrific price!!! The macro setting is what I bought the camera for since I like to take a lot of pictures of the flowers and fish that I catch.
Comments: My mom has been so thrilled with the quality of my pictures that she is ordering one now!!!

Title: Great "Prosumer" Camera
Cons:
Any negatives I have are more: "I wish it had" than real cons. 

I wish it had a "bulb" setting to give a little more creativity to the user. (it has a 4 sec. to 1/1000 shutter range)
If you don't want to use the large (2.5") rear LCD, for framing your shots, it uses an eye level electronic view finder (EVF). Either of which are always on and can be a power usage concern - although, battery life was still pretty good. I used the camera on and off for a day and captured about 170 pix using 2400mAh batteries. 
I wish it had and optical eye level view finder, but then there would be parallax problems with the 10X zoom and the cost of linking the optics to the view finder would surely add a lot more to the price (keep saving for a DSLR if you want features like that).
Image color is very good, but... areas of high contrast - say where the sky meets the trees - has some bluish purple fringing. Still, the images I took that were under even contrast or those at sunset were awesome!
Pros:
Great  "Prosumer" dig. camera for the price (and it's now about a hundred $ less than last year's average price). 

7-megapixels, 10x optical zoom lens (38-380mm in 35mm equivalence), a lot of exposure modes, takes SD and xD cards, takes very good movies with sound (and you can even zoom while shooting movies).
Uses 4 AA batteries, so you're never far from spares (but get a set of 2400 NiMH rechargeable batteries for better use).
It can capture 3 frames in under 2 seconds in "Top 3"mode and continuously at about 2 second intervals in "Long Period" mode. 
A ISO range of 64 to 1600 (but shadows start to get a little noisey at 400 and highlights at 800).
Comments:
One more (con?); the LCD or EyeVF blacks out in between shots (not in the burst mode, though). A little like closing your eyes when you press the shutter relese.
But again, it's providing a nearly SLR-like view finder for a lower price, I you want an SLR you'll have to pay about 4 times (starting price) than what you'll pay for this camera.

This would be great camera even if it cost a hundred $ more.

Title: Grainy shots, but all around great

Pros: A lot of features for the price, it's nice and hefty as well so it keeps steady.

Pros: Great picture quality out doors!  Great zoom!

Title: Read the Reviews (all of em)
Cons:
After taking literally hundreds of shots (many of the same thing multitudes of times) this camera just isn't consistant. Indoor shots are grainy, grainy, grainy. The camera struggles to focus indoors and compensates by using a higher ISO. Anything over ISO 200 is pretty much useless but that's not uncommon in a point and shoot.

Outdoors this camers fares infinitely better. 

The bundled Fuji software is useless, I like the MS wizard much better, it's faster and doesn't automatically move the photo's into the Fuji folder (without asking) where it's much more complicated to do any adjustments or cropping.

The USB door and the battery door both seem somewhat flimsy. Time will tell.
Pros:
There really are a myriad of things to like about this camera. Everything is well thought out, buttons are placed logically, numerous shooting modes, EVF, pop up flash, menu relatively easy to navigate through. When you get a great shot the detail is unparalled. 

Takes SD/SDHC or xD memory. I'm using an 4G SDHC card. I like being able to use AA and rechargeable NiMH batteries. Ability to shoot in color, chrome or B&W. Plenty of manual modes.

Mostly I like the size. It's not like trying to take a picture with a credit card which I find awkward. The grip is rubberized which makes it firm and easy to hold. Boots up and is ready to go in about 1 second. Memory card slot is separate from the battery compartment. 

Definately a bang for the buck.
Comments:
The macro mode is incredible, detail is better than my Lumix DMC-LZ7or Canon S5 IS. The strap design is awful, once it's on it's on, it's very diffucult to remove or adjust. Lens cap snaps on and off easily but must be attached to the strap. Where I naturally want to grip the camera with my left hand is right over the pop-up flash, guess I'll try and get used to it. 

I am going to keep playing with this but I'm betting I'll return it. I want to love it, so far I just can't.

Title: Great "Prosumer" Camera

Title: Read the Reviews (all of em)
Cons:
After taking literally hundreds of shots (many of the same thing multitudes of times) this camera just isn't consistant. Indoor shots are grainy, grainy, grainy. The camera struggles to focus indoors and compensates by using a higher ISO. Anything over ISO 200 is pretty much useless but that's not uncommon in a point and shoot.

Outdoors this camers fares infinitely better. 

The bundled Fuji software is useless, I like the MS wizard much better, it's faster and doesn't automatically move the photo's into the Fuji folder (without asking) where it's much more complicated to do any adjustments or cropping.

The USB door and the battery door both seem somewhat flimsy. Time will tell.
Pros:
There really are a myriad of things to like about this camera. Everything is well thought out, buttons are placed logically, numerous shooting modes, EVF, pop up flash, menu relatively easy to navigate through. When you get a great shot the detail is unparalled. 

Takes SD/SDHC or xD memory. I'm using an 4G SDHC card. I like being able to use AA and rechargeable NiMH batteries. Ability to shoot in color, chrome or B&W. Plenty of manual modes.

Mostly I like the size. It's not like trying to take a picture with a credit card which I find awkward. The grip is rubberized which makes it firm and easy to hold. Boots up and is ready to go in about 1 second. Memory card slot is separate from the battery compartment. 

Definately a bang for the buck.
Comments:
The macro mode is incredible, detail is better than my Lumix DMC-LZ7or Canon S5 IS. The strap design is awful, once it's on it's on, it's very diffucult to remove or adjust. Lens cap snaps on and off easily but must be attached to the strap. Where I naturally want to grip the camera with my left hand is right over the pop-up flash, guess I'll try and get used to it. 

I am going to keep playing with this but I'm betting I'll return it. I want to love it, so far I just can't.

Cons: Slight lag in button push and picture take on some manual settings NO other cons found yet
Pros: Look, if you want a great little digital camera for a great price, buy it.  Easy to use. Excellent pictures on almost all settings, Video is good, 46mm threads on lens for accessories, Too many goodies to discover in a month, anti-shake works well, I LOVE IT.
Comments: Just get one, you'll be happy. Don't buy from those other DISCOUNT places.... you'll wind up with NEWEGG on your face.

Title: Great "Prosumer" Camera
Cons:
Any negatives I have are more: "I wish it had" than real cons. 

I wish it had a "bulb" setting to give a little more creativity to the user. (it has a 4 sec. to 1/1000 shutter range)
If you don't want to use the large (2.5") rear LCD, for framing your shots, it uses an eye level electronic view finder (EVF). Either of which are always on and can be a power usage concern - although, battery life was still pretty good. I used the camera on and off for a day and captured about 170 pix using 2400mAh batteries. 
I wish it had and optical eye level view finder, but then there would be parallax problems with the 10X zoom and the cost of linking the optics to the view finder would surely add a lot more to the price (keep saving for a DSLR if you want features like that).
Image color is very good, but... areas of high contrast - say where the sky meets the trees - has some bluish purple fringing. Still, the images I took that were under even contrast or those at sunset were awesome!
Pros:
Great  "Prosumer" dig. camera for the price (and it's now about a hundred $ less than last year's average price). 

7-megapixels, 10x optical zoom lens (38-380mm in 35mm equivalence), a lot of exposure modes, takes SD and xD cards, takes very good movies with sound (and you can even zoom while shooting movies).
Uses 4 AA batteries, so you're never far from spares (but get a set of 2400 NiMH rechargeable batteries for better use).
It can capture 3 frames in under 2 seconds in "Top 3"mode and continuously at about 2 second intervals in "Long Period" mode. 
A ISO range of 64 to 1600 (but shadows start to get a little noisey at 400 and highlights at 800).
Comments:
One more (con?); the LCD or EyeVF blacks out in between shots (not in the burst mode, though). A little like closing your eyes when you press the shutter relese.
But again, it's providing a nearly SLR-like view finder for a lower price, I you want an SLR you'll have to pay about 4 times (starting price) than what you'll pay for this camera.

This would be great camera even if it cost a hundred $ more.

Title: Grainy shots, but all around great
Cons: The larger shots always turn out grainy, it might be something I set wrong, but I doubt it.
Pros: A lot of features for the price, it's nice and hefty as well so it keeps steady.

Cons: Poor quality indoors, bulky.
Pros: Great picture quality out doors!  Great zoom!
Comments: I have been using this camera for 8 months now.  When it comes to taking pictures outside it takes amazing pictures, however when you're inside think about switching the camera.  The indoor pictures tend to be more blurry and bleed more.  Out of a scale of 1 to 10 as 10 being the greatest, outdoor - 10, indoor - 3.

Title: Awesome
Cons: None that I have.
Pros: Zoom is great, Really easy to use. Has a great point and shoot or if you are advanced great manual features.

Cons: shipping was a little slow,gas prices an all ! , lol , i now see its eaven cheaper then when i purchased it,oh well, thats life, lol
Pros: excellent camera for the $$$ ,when i purchased this camera i didnt expect much for the $$,but i was happily wrong with this that assumption,it has  easy to understand optoins, takes great indoor and out door pics., eaven takes short vidio,w/27MB of built in memory, you just cant beat the price !!!

Title: Read the Reviews (all of em)
Cons:
After taking literally hundreds of shots (many of the same thing multitudes of times) this camera just isn't consistant. Indoor shots are grainy, grainy, grainy. The camera struggles to focus indoors and compensates by using a higher ISO. Anything over ISO 200 is pretty much useless but that's not uncommon in a point and shoot.

Outdoors this camers fares infinitely better. 

The bundled Fuji software is useless, I like the MS wizard much better, it's faster and doesn't automatically move the photo's into the Fuji folder (without asking) where it's much more complicated to do any adjustments or cropping.

The USB door and the battery door both seem somewhat flimsy. Time will tell.
Pros:
There really are a myriad of things to like about this camera. Everything is well thought out, buttons are placed logically, numerous shooting modes, EVF, pop up flash, menu relatively easy to navigate through. When you get a great shot the detail is unparalled. 

Takes SD/SDHC or xD memory. I'm using an 4G SDHC card. I like being able to use AA and rechargeable NiMH batteries. Ability to shoot in color, chrome or B&W. Plenty of manual modes.

Mostly I like the size. It's not like trying to take a picture with a credit card which I find awkward. The grip is rubberized which makes it firm and easy to hold. Boots up and is ready to go in about 1 second. Memory card slot is separate from the battery compartment. 

Definately a bang for the buck.
Comments:
The macro mode is incredible, detail is better than my Lumix DMC-LZ7or Canon S5 IS. The strap design is awful, once it's on it's on, it's very diffucult to remove or adjust. Lens cap snaps on and off easily but must be attached to the strap. Where I naturally want to grip the camera with my left hand is right over the pop-up flash, guess I'll try and get used to it. 

I am going to keep playing with this but I'm betting I'll return it. I want to love it, so far I just can't.

Title: Great buy!!
Cons: Indoor pictures come out a bit grainy and yellowed in natural light.  The flash is almost too bright for indoor pictures.  I had the camera glitch saying "Memory Full" once an SD card had filled.  It would no longer take a photo.  After formatting the card, buying a new card, trying everything - I almost gave up.  I stumbled onto a fix - I removed the card, turned on the camera and took a picture into its internal memory.  This cleared the Memory Full lockout, and I could use SD cards again.
Pros: Price is right.  Outdoor pictures come out great.  The battery life is around 500 pictures or more depending on use.  Movies come out in great detail.  TONS of shooting modes including night, fireworks, super macro closeup, etc...  Overall I am very happy with the purchase.
Comments: (Optimize battery life by using an xD card, using the viewfinder, keeping camera on-time to a , avoiding the flash when possible, and don't review photos using the LCD.)  This would likely double the battery life which is already good IMO.

Cons: No problems with my computer finding it, but didn't come with an install disk so some computers might have trouble finding it.
Pros: Great Camera for a terrific price!!! The macro setting is what I bought the camera for since I like to take a lot of pictures of the flowers and fish that I catch.
Comments: My mom has been so thrilled with the quality of my pictures that she is ordering one now!!!

Title: Professional features, entry price!
Cons: No option for additional lenses
Pros: 10x Optical Zoom, 7.1MP, wide array of shooting options (including manual shutter speed controls), ergonomic design fits comfortably in your hands and feels "sturdy and balanced", SLR-like design, entry-level price
Comments: This is a remarkable camera for the price...don't question getting it...just buy the thing!
